job_to_be_done.task: Prepare a vegetarian buffet-style dinner menu for a corporate gathering, including gluten-free items.

subsection_analysis.refined_text: Toast pita breads until crispy, then break into pieces. o Dice tomatoes and cucumber, slice red onion. o Mix vegetables with chopped parsley and mint. o Whisk lemon juice, olive oil, sumac, and salt, then pour over salad. o Toss well and serve.

Sauté shredded coconut until lightly browned. o Add rice, coconut milk, water, and salt. o Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer until rice is tender. o Serve warm. Shred cabbage and grate carrots. o Mix mayonnaise, vinegar, sugar, and salt in a bowl. o Toss cabbage and carrots with dressing. o Chill for at least 1 hour before serving.

Slice baguette and toast until golden. o Rub toasted bread with cut garlic cloves. o Grate tomatoes and spread on bread. o Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with salt. o Serve immediately. 1 pound paneer o 1/2 cup yogurt o 1 tablespoon lemon juice o 1 teaspoon cumin o 1 teaspoon coriander o 1 teaspoon garam masala o 1 teaspoon turmeric

Dice tomatoes and cucumber, slice red onion. o Mix vegetables with olives and crumbled feta cheese. o Whisk olive oil, vinegar, oregano, and salt, then pour over salad. o Toss well and serve. 4 cups green beans o 1 can cream of mushroom soup o 1/2 cup milk o 1 cup fried onions o 1 teaspoon salt o 1/2 teaspoon pepper
Peel and dice potatoes. o Sauté potatoes in sesame oil until lightly browned. o Add soy sauce, sugar, and water, simmer until potatoes are tender. o Garnish with sesame seeds and serve warm.
